p: We previously demonstrated that during chilling-induced dormancy release various members of the 1,3-β-glucanase enzyme-family localize to plasmodesmata where they hydrolyse callose at DSC, thereby potentiating cell-cell metabolic coupling, transport and communication [ 40]. The present data show that the GA 3-inducible γ-clade 1,3-β-glucanase genes, GH17_44 and GH17_101, were considerably upregulated under continuous low temperature (Fig. 6b). In contrast, the structurally different α-clade 1,3-β-glucanase genes, GH17_33 and GH17_102, which possess a GPI-anchor for localization to the outer leaflet of the plasma membrane, remained relatively unaffected by the low temperature (Fig. 6b).
